column4: hey anyone using gnome-panel's auto-hide feature? it doesnt show-up after its been hidden, anyone else experiencing the same thing?
make sure that the panel does not have an unusually high unhide delay set in gconf-editor
yeah i checked it, its safe.
have you tried using gconf-editor to turn off auto-hide and then re-enable it?
sometimes quirky things like that take care of the issue
yeah, it works that way, but no one would like to fix it everytime with gconf editor
am i the only one having the issue?
not suffesting using gconf-editor everytime you need to access the panel. Just that changing the settings and then putting them back may fix the problem
does the same problem occur when you change the panel orientation?
yes, placing panel anywhere, it shows the same problem
are you having any similar problems?
no, I have not run into this problem
What is the autohide size set to in gconf-editor?
try setting it to 4 and see if it unhides. I realize it won't be completely hidden, but just give it a shot
nope, it wont work, i think its nothing to do with the unhide problem
perhaps - I suggested 4 because I just spoke with colleague that had a similar problem on Karmic. Panel would not unhide unless the auot_hide_size was at least 4
not sure what else to suggest though
do you have any drawers on the panel? are you using Compiz?
yeah, compiz, no drawers, i think i might switch to metacity and that would work
that was my next suggestion. Doing som quick reading shows Compiz as a major cause for panels not unhiding. I have not seen any immediate solutions though.
okay lemme try
this is surprising, i tried many times before switiching to metacity, if i get my mouse pointer to any of the corners it works all the time. its weird.
may be 100/150 pixels from the edge, it works.
